Project Summary 
 
The Digital Transport Adapter (DTA) is a low-cost, customer premise device that allows broadcast digital signals to be demodulated as analog signals intended for analog devices. The principle deployment scenario for this device is to enable reclamation of the analog spectrum, while still supporting customer outlets where only analog display equipment exists. The DTA is a one-way device that uses In-band.

Target customers for this product will typically be running Cisco’s SARA (Scientific Atlanta Resident Application) guide in their system today. Project Summary 
 
The Digital Transport Adapter (DTA) is a low-cost, customer premise device that allows broadcast digital signals to be demodulated as analog signals intended for analog devices. The principle deployment scenario for this device is to enable reclamation of the analog spectrum, while still supporting customer outlets where only analog display equipment exists. The DTA is a one-way device that uses In-band.

Project Summary 
 
The project was about executing the Touch Performance reliability of Touch based phones with operating system Android/Windows. The main aim was to provide results of Touch sensors using various methods so that the management can have one to one comparison between various commercial Touch phones as well as Qualcomm proprietary phones with Snapdragon chips. Following are the devices which were tested & compared for Touch Sensors: 
 
•	Nexus 7, Asus Transformer – Android Platform 
•	I-Pad 3, I-Phone – iOS Platform

•	Test Development, execution, troubleshooting and problem resolution on Android/Windows/Standalone CoreBSP platforms

Project Summary 
 
The RTN (Reference TV Navigator) on Cable project (CRTN) is intended to merge the capabilities of Cisco’s Reference TV Navigator (RTN), currently available for IP platforms and latest-generation cable set top. Target customers for this product will typically be running Cisco’s SARA (Scientific Atlanta Resident Application) guide in their system today. In addition, when deployed in a cable (HFC) environment, many RTN features will rely on the same system infrastructure (e.g. BFS and App Server) which is used for SARA today. This product is developed for ROGERS targeting customers of Canada.

Project Description : 
CiscoWorks Health and Utilization Monitor (HUM) is a Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP)-based MIB polling application [NMS] that monitors network elements (such as CPU, memory, interfaces/ports, and links) for their availability and utilization levels and provides historical reporting. 
CiscoWorks HUM is pre-integrated with CiscoWorks LAN Management Solution (LMS) 3.0. CiscoWorks HUM is designed as an add-on product and fits well with the existing CiscoWorks LMS 3.0 applications. 
CiscoWorks HUM provides organizations with: 
Support for system-defined MIB templates enables easy polling setup 
The capability for users to create custom MIB templates 
Historical reporting on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis 
Comprehensive reporting such as Device Dashboard, Custom Reports, Top-N/Bottom-N Reports 
Threshold breach event notification, reporting, and event handler support 
An easy-to-use GUI that includes LMS Portal view 
CiscoWorks HUM provides end users with: 
Capacity planning 
A clear way to troubleshoot network performance issues 
The capability to isolate/correlate network issues.

Project Description : 
LMS is a network management application [NMS]. IPM (Internetwork Performance Monitor) is one of the applications in LMS. 
IPM monitors the performance of multi protocol network. It measures the performance statistics of the network. IPM monitors the network performance by configuring collectors on IP SLA (IP Service Level Agreement) capable source devices (routers) and collects the performance-related statistics from these devices. 
Usage: 
Measure latency, availability, and jitter between two network endpoints.  
Monitor packet loss and errors between two network endpoints.  
Discover network paths between two network endpoints and monitor network performance statistics on a hop-by-hop basis.  
 
Responsibilities include : 
* Study of the PRD / Functional Specifications for the application. 
* Test Plan preparation 
* Test Case Execution 
* Functional / Manual Testing 
* Regression Testing 
* System and Performance testing. 
* Automation Testing using HTMLUnit (writing automation scripts using Java).
